page.title: 02THE TIBETAN MONASTRY
page.content: Situated on the banks of the White Esk river is the heart of a Buddhist community, the {Kagyu Samye Ling {Tibetan Centre},the first Tibetan centre to be established in the western world. It is named after { {Samye},the first major Buddhist monastry and lay meditation centre of Tibet,founded in the 8th century. {Samye Ling}is administered by the Johnson House Trust affiliated to the Karma Kagyu Trust.It was started in Eskdalemuir in 1967 by two lamas exiled when the Chinese invaded Tibet. It has been steadily developing and is now established as a school of meditation and intellectual pursuits, as well as of practical skills.
